H0.text: An observation is that students notice that in the fall the leaves of sugar maple trees turn red while the leaves of black oak trees turn brown.

H1.text: A conclusion is being made by the students that in the fall the leaves of sugar maple trees turn red, while the leaves of black oak trees turn brown.

H2.text: A prediction is being made by the students who observe that in the fall sugar maple leaves turn red while black oak leaves turn brown.

H3.text: An inference is being made by the students when they observe that in the fall, leaves of sugar maple trees turn red while leaves of black oak trees turn brown.

A4.text: The fall color is often spectacular, ranging from bright yellow on some trees through orange to fluorescent red-orange on others.
